title: French Toast
description: This was the recipe from the assignment that snowballed this whole project.
directions: Beat together egg, milk, salt, spices and vanilla.
Heat a lightly oiled pan over medium-high heat.
Dunk each slice of bread in egg mixture, soaking both sides.
Place in pan and cook on both sides until golden.
Serve hot.

title: Penne Alla Vodka
description: Most delicious pasta, easy to cook and impressive to others.
directions: Puree tommatos, finely slice garlic and prosciutto.
Cook prosciutto in the olive oil on medium to high heat.
When the prosciutto begins to crisp up add the garlic and basil stem.
When the garlic browns, turn off heat and add vodka.
Let the vodka calm down, and turn heat back on until the vodka is reduced to almost nothing.
Remove the basil stem, and add the pureed tomatoes.
While waiting for the tomatoes to reduce, cook the pasta in a pot of salted water.
Reduce tomatoes until the sauce becomes very thick.
Add the cream, red pepper, salt, pepper and allow to simmer for a few minutes.
Once the pasta is al dente, drain and transfer to the sauce with the butter allowing a few minutes for the pasta to marry the sauce
Serve with the parm and parsley as a garnish.

title: Spiced Apple Pancakes
description: Stolen from based.cooking in the process of trying to fill out this site with recipes.
directions: In a medium bowl, combine flour, sugar, cinnamon, baking powder and salt.
Separate egg yolk and egg white. Add the egg yolk to the dry ingredients.
Whisk the egg white until foamy.
Slice the peeled apple into thin strips. Alternatively, grate the apple.
Combine dry ingredients, apple, vanilla extract, egg white and milk to create a batter.
Heat butter in a large pan. Add the batter (about 3 tbsp per pancake) and cook for 2 minutes per side on medium height.

title: Sweet and Sour Chicken Noodles
ingredients: 2 x 200g chicken thighs, skin on, bone in
directions: Pull the skin off the chicken. Place the skin in a large non-stick frying pan on a medium heat to render and get golden, turning occasionally.
Cut the bones out of the thighs and chuck into the pan for bonus flavour, then chop the meat into 2cm pieces.
Move the skin and bones to one side of the pan, then add the meat alongside and cook for 5 minutes, or until golden, stirring occasionally.
Once crispy, remove, chop and reserve the skin, discarding the bones.
Meanwhile, cook the noodles in boiling salted water according to the packet instructions. Halve the sugar snaps lengthways.
Once soft, drain the noodles, reserving a mugful of cooking water, then refresh under cold water.
Use scissors to snip the noodles into roughly 8cm lengths.
Stir the Worcestershire sauce and chilli jam into the chicken pan and let the jam melt, then add the sugar snaps and noodles.
Toss over the heat for 2 minutes, adding a splash of reserved noodle water to loosen, if needed.
Taste and season to perfection with sea salt and black pepper, then dish up and sprinkle over the reserved crispy chicken skin.

title: Teriyaki Fish Skewers
ingredients: 500g ling fish fillets, cut into 3cm cubes
directions: Combine teriyaki sauce and garlc in a bowl.
Add fish and stir to coat.
Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour, if time permits
Thread fish onto skewers. place on a plate.
Heat oil in a large non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook skewers for 3 to 4 minutes on each side or until cooked through.
Serve with rice and vegetables.

title: Zucchini Slice
directions: Preheat the oven to 170C.
Beat the eggs in a large bowl until combined
Add the flour and beat until smooth.
Add zucchini, onion, bacon, cheese and oil and stir to combine.
Grease and line a 30 x 20cm lamington pan. Pour in the mixture and bake for 30 minutes or until cooked through.
